file_content.text: Our business is concluded. We wish you luck in your future endeavors.
We are so very impressed you survived Shadow Town. Congratulations.
Did that female shanjaru fly here?
The repulsorlift cage made a dramatic entrance during the twenty-seventh course.
The Great Feastmaster was excessively delighted by his female specimen's return. As we assured you, his interest in your shanjaru is renewed.
Drooga has already contacted your associate to arrange the details....
Our shanjaru will be there shortly, Drooga dear.
At last, I have a matching set of shanjaru! The only surviving male and female of an entire species are all mine!
Rumor is you're going to eat them.
Dinner time, huh?
Exactly! It will be the most unique feast I have ever thrown.
You could repopulate the galaxy. Give the beasts a second chance.
Breed them.
Why would I do that? They're a failed species. They deserve to become extinct!
Easily amused, aren't you?
My duties as the Great Feastmaster keep me busy enough, spacer.
I've sent your starship engine to the spaceport, beautiful Risha. Come--celebrate our deal!
Love to, but I need to install that prototype engine. Maybe next time?
This fancy new engine--what's it do?
Prototype?
It's a sublight engine optimized for extreme gravitational environments. You can read the manual.
I'll expect that engine to be installed when I get back.
Get to work, Risha.
You heard the captain, Drooga. I have my orders.
You know how to install a freighter engine?
Wait, you're a mechanic?
Did I not mention I'm a starship mechanic? Pretty good one, too.
Come on, Risha. Don't leave this Hutt hanging.
Drooga has a crush on you.
The next time you come to Nar Shaddaa, beautiful Risha, I'll expect you to dance with me.
It's a date, Drooga. Come see me when you're ready to lift off, Captain.
Aha! The once-mighty Bowdaar returns! Good! I was almost getting bored.
You poisoned me, Hutt!
The Wookiee's final performance begins.
And then the Wookiee goes free?
Final performance?
If by "free" you mean dead, then yes.
That doesn't sound good.
You have affection for the beast? Unfortunate.
Perhaps we should find a quiet corner? This may get messy.
The gambler refuses to repay his debt to Drooga, so the Wookiee is now property of the Great Feastmaster.
Gentlebeings, watch as the Wookiee becomes a meal for my pet gundark! I have been starving it just for this occasion!
Will the gundark swallow the Wookiee whole, or chew? If he chews, how many bites will it take? Such drama!
This isn't entertainment, it's an execution. How much to get Bowdaar off the hook?
Let me buy Bowdaar's freedom.
Credits no longer interest me, only drama! Prepare for death, mighty Bowdaar!
You want drama, Hutt? You got it. Come here, you big ugly!
Enough. [Attack Gundark]
Tag out, Bowdaar! I'll pin that gundark's ears to the floor!
No way! [Rescue Bowdaar]
You're a slug, Drooga. [Fight]
Hang on, Bowdaar--I'll save you!
Forget this! [Rescue Bowdaar.]
You want drama? [Attack Gundark]
Release the gundark!
Bowdaar fights to the death!
Good luck in Shadow Town.
The Senator's daughter has made a critical error trusting Lazhae. He is no friend to her.
Before the Empire imprisoned Lazhae in Shadow Town, we purchased some of his beast experiments for Drooga's pleasure. Ghastly abominations.
This guy must be really evil to get imprisoned on Nar Shaddaa.
Lazhae sounds like bad news.
He was considered too depraved, even for the Empire. That should tell you something.
I've never heard about any prison on Nar Shaddaa.
What is Shadow Town?
The Empire created it for those deemed too valuable to kill, but too dangerous to release. Prisoners are restrained by cranial bombs.
Why would Drooga buy this guy's creatures?
Beast experiments?
Lazhae is a genetic engineer. He manufactured a few interesting predators Drooga found amusing.
If Lazhae has Drooga's beast, it may already be too late. Shadow Town is extraordinarily dangerous, but you must hurry.
Ga'ram! I tire of this sector! Move my pleasure barge!
If you find Drooga's shanjaru, come to these coordinates. Goodbye....
And hello. The name's Zank Helrott, Captain. I'm Rogun the Butcher's personal bounty hunter.
Is that a man or a hover tank?
You like my armor? I polished it for this occasion.
Zank, you're the shiniest bounty hunter I've ever met.
You sure are sparkly.
I hate to be picky, but right under your elbow? Pretty dingy.
You missed a spot.
You've got a talent for digging holes with your mouth.
I've been looking forward to this chat for a while.
It's so great to finally meet you, Zanky.
Me too!
Wish I could say the same.
That makes one of us.
That's not nice. You don't even know me. I'm a great guy.
Am I supposed to be impressed by you, scum-sucker?
You piece of filth.
Look, there's no reason we can't be civil.
Rogun says I can bring you back in pieces. Hope you don't mind. I've got some new weapons to test.
Leave my friend alone, metal man.
You've got a half-dead Wookiee for a sidekick. Guess beggars can't be choosers.
This Wookiee's all I need to finish you off.
He's more than enough.
And me. And my blaster. I call her Sparky.
There's something unwholesome about a man who names his weapons.
It's almost a shame to kill you, precious.
Let's finish this!
Bowdaar, I want you to sit this one out.
I can handle you myself.
Too bad. I need a new Wookiee pelt.
I don't need help killing worm-ridden filth like you.
You're already dead, pal.
I'll teach you some manners before you die.
We are so pleased to see you alive. How goes the search?
The woman who stole Drooga's beast took it to someone named Lazhae. Ever heard of him?
Ga'ram! The twentieth course hasn't arrived, and the Wookiee already slew my Colicoid. I am bored!
The giant bug smelled bad. It annoyed me.
Stupid Wookiee! Even after draining half his blood and taking all his weapons, he is still too powerful!
That's a Wookiee for you.
Of course he is.
This is no ordinary Wookiee! He must have Jedi training, or something.
I fought a Jedi once. Very sad.
You drained his blood?
I demand drama for my guests! Where is the excitement in ten-second duels?
The Hutt doesn't understand fighting.
If he makes you so angry, just vaporize him.
So kill him, already.
But there must be drama! Fear in his eyes!
Bowdaar fears nothing.
Do not despair, O Great Feastmaster. We will find you suitable entertainment.
Drooga must be more gentle. He forgets the Wookiee is collateral. When the gambler repays his debt, he will expect his Wookiee returned intact.
What happens if the gambler doesn't pay his debt?
The gambler might not return.
Then the Wookiee becomes Drooga's property. But let us discuss your information.
The Wookiee is a slave?
The gambler won the Wookiee playing sabacc. Forget that beast, hmm? Your revelation is more interesting.
I couldn't care less about the Wookiee.
That doesn't interest me.
Of course not. It is only a beast. Let us return to your discovery.
The Great Feastmaster demands our attention. We will see you again soon, we hope....
Look here. This holorecording was left by the thieves who stole Drooga's female shanjaru. It may interest you....
When will the Hutts learn that nature's creatures are not for their sick entertainment?
So long as innocent beasts are victimized by the decadent slave masters of Nar Shaddaa, we will fight! Freedom for all life!
The woman continues like this for another three hours. We use her recording to lull ourselves to sleep at night.
That's who stole Drooga's beast?
She's the thief?
She's a real windbag, all right.
I can see why.
We are grateful her discourse is not the equal of her passion. We need our rest.
The only thing I feel after watching that holo is violently angry.
It doesn't make me sleepy.
How fortunate. She is someone you may need to kill.
The woman is a wealthy Republic Senator's daughter. She violently opposes all who "abuse" wild creatures.
She spends her father's wealth hiring mercenaries to fight her war. They maintain a base nearby.
Sounds like I should give these mercenaries a visit.
I'll head for the base.
Maybe I'll find that woman or the creature she stole at the mercenary base?
Think she's there?
We are sure we do not know, but perhaps those mercenaries do.
Those mercenaries are going to pay for complicating my life.
Not for long.
We admire your affection for violent solutions.
Should you discover any useful leads, bring them to us. We will happily assist your search.
Ga'ram! Move my pleasure barge! Take our guests someplace interesting!
We will dock this pleasure barge at these coordinates. Find us there. Good hunting....
We overheard your conversation with the Great Feastmaster. Drooga can be most fickle. You have our deepest sympathies, we are sure.
Is there anything "we" can do about it?
If you seek to conclude your business with Drooga, use his fickle nature to your advantage.
Returning Drooga's female beast would rekindle his interest in yours.
I don't even know what happened. How am I supposed to find this thing?
That's a tall order.
How can you know for certain?
We have observed the Great Feastmaster in past dealings. Drooga is always most captivated by what is easily at hand.
I'm not a repo service, get me?
It's not my job.
Which is more important, your pride or your goal?
We serve the Great Feastmaster, Drooga the Hutt. You are honored to be in his presence, we are sure.
Sorry pal--this isn't my fight. Good luck.
Oh, well. [Let Bowdaar die.]
Fifty credits says the gundark swallows the Wookiee whole.
I like it. [Let Bowdaar die.]
Apologies, but we don't gamble. We are saving for our retirement.
Goodbye, Wookiee! Entertain me one last time!
Bowdaar dies with honor!
Ready to put on a show for these fine ladies and gentlebeings?
My dance moves are a little rusty, but I'll try.
I'll do my best.
And a-one and a-two....
How about you surrender and join the party?
Or we could forget about this.
Just shut up and fight!
I'll show these people how to roast a pig-lizard in his own armor.
You're about to die.
I've had enough of your mouth!
Hardly seems fair.
